text: hi everyone I'm Lindsay strand and today
on sweet talk I'm making maple
cheesecake with roasted pears this is a
luscious no-bake cheesecake that looks
so elegant topped with maple roasted
pears so my cheesecake sets up in the
fridge I'll work on my pear topping here
I have a pear
I've already cut one up but I'm gonna
show you how to mandolin this one I am
going to use a towel as my guard because
I don't have the plastic guard anymore
but the guard is definitely something
good to use so that you don't slice your
fingers sometimes you can even wet it to
help out with the grip and this is a
Bosc pear you could also use Bartlett or
a red Bartlett would be really beautiful
something that has my screen skin would
be nice too and as you can see I'm just
thinly slicing this these are about 1/8
inch thick this is what the slices look
like when they're done and I'm just
going to put these onto a lightly
greased baking sheet right now they're
really crunchy and firm but once they're
roasted they'll be nice and soft easy to
put on top of the cheesecake I like
slicing them lengthwise like this
because I think the pear shape is really
beautiful reminds me of beautiful fall
fruit you really only need one or two
pears because you're slicing it so
thinly you can see I have some extra so
this will be my snack for the day so you
really only need one sheet to do this
for your cheesecake set those aside
and now I'm going to brush them with
maple syrup
this will sweeten them up a little bit
make them really delicious then use
about two tablespoons so half of this
bowl and this is pure maple syrup you
want to make sure that you use the good
stuff here because you'll be amazed when
you read the label how many fake syrup
products are out there these days and
that's really just like a sweetener but
it doesn't have that delicious meatball
flavor it's usually something
like think extract chemical compound
that tastes like maple that you want the
good stuff here so these are going into
the oven I've preheated the oven to 450
degrees they're going in for 20 minutes
and so they're soft and pliable so my
pears are fresh out of the oven they
smell amazing
and now I've turned my oven to the
broiler setting and I'm going to brush
them with the remaining two tablespoons
of maple syrup because now that they're
soft we're going to get them nice and
caramelized just stop them on as you can
see they shrink up a little bit in the
oven it's almost like making a pear chip
or you know like a dried fruit chip
except at a higher temperature I think
they're so beautiful the way this thing
curls up around the edges
you could definitely peel the pears if
you wanted to if you're not a fan of the
skin but I think it adds such a
beautiful edge to the pear it adds a
little bit of contrast and it makes some
curl up so beautifully that I like to
keep it on I don't mind it wait now
these are going back under the broiler
for just a couple of minutes until
they're nice and caramelized I'm ready
to decorate I've pulled my cheesecake
out of the fridge unmolded it and now my
pears have cooled completely you can see
they're a little bit caramelized around
the edges there's some beautiful frilly
skin they've browned nicely don't be
afraid if they get a little bit
blackened around the edges I think that
gives it a lot of texture flavor a
little bit of deeper character for your
cheesecake and now I'm ready
place these on top beautiful and shiny a
little bit translucent cuz they're so
thin you just want to overlap these
slightly on your cake make a nice pretty
pattern so I'm just layering these
slightly overlapping around the cake
pretty design I love that this looks so
organic
I think the boss compares make it really
nice very elegant and a little bit
elevated because of that beautiful brown
skin and I love the texture of these
frilly edges one more here and then the
last pair will be for me so look at that
I think this is so
stunning so impressive but as you saw it
so easy to make and these roasted pears
really take a simple cheesecake over the
top I think this will be so perfect to
serve at any autumn party enjoy if
you're enjoying this video be sure to
